intro: Ilex macropoda, commonly known as the broadleaf holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aquifoliaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, where it typically grows in moist, acidic soils. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that remain green throughout the year. Its small, red berries are an important food source for various bird species. Ilex macropoda is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive foliage and hardy nature.
